result.execSummary:
The defendant William D Johns was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Prison term on Ct 3 in this same case.
Concurrent with: Extended Supervision on Ct 3 in this same case.  conditions of extended supervision are the same conditions as probation on this same case.
Concurrent with: Probation on Ct 3 in this same case as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request  Defendant will attend domestic violence counseling.

The defendant shall have no contact with Carrie Johns of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way unless he has approval of the victim and of his  agent.  
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  The defendant shall submit to random PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.

Prosecutor Lyndsey A.B. Brunette and Defendant, William D Johns, in custody, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-08-2016 02:00 pm
Prosecutor Kerra Stumbris and Defendant, William D Johns, in custody, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Final pre-trial at 01-07-2016 01:20 pm

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State; Defendant appeared in person via video conference from Clark County Jail with Attorney Christine Kuczynski appearing in person in court.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 01:20 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 09-29-2015 10:30 am.
Status conference at 10-15-2015 02:20 pm.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person via video conference from Clark County Jail with Attorney Kuczynski appearing in person in court.   Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  The defense waived reading of the complaint and stood mute to the charges.  BASED ON THE DEFENDANT STANDING MUTE,THE COURT ENTERED A NOT GUILTY PLEA ON BEHALF OF THE DEFENDANT  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 02:20 pm.
Atty Kuczynski
Adjourned initial appearance at 09-17-2015 11:40 am

The defendant shall have no contact with C.J. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 11:40 am.
